How? By having business associates that owe him money to put it into his foundation instead. An excellent example is that the Trump Foundation took in payments â€œtotaling nearly $1.9 million from a man in New York City who sells sought-after tickets and one-of-a-kind experiences to wealthy clients.â€ According to sources in the Trump organization who wish to remain anonymous the man is Richard Ebers, and he was told that instead of paying the former reality TV star for services, he should pay the Trump Foundation instead.
